It is also possible to write a Shiny app that takes the input sentence from the user and then computes the frequency count for the given bigram. However, this would require additional code and possibly a web-based interface. 

In general, frequencycount() is a built-in function in R used for counting the number of instances of a given pattern in a sequence (e.g., for counting the frequency of words in a text document). So, if you had a large text corpus, you could use this function to compute the frequency of any given pattern. However, in this case we are using the function to compute the frequency of a given bigram in a single sentence. 

I hope this answer helps you to build a Shiny app based on the R code I provided. Let me know if you have any further questions.
